content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
I received information that Japan plans to release over a million tons of treated but still radioactive wastewater from the Fukushima nuclear plant into the Pacific Ocean in two years. The water will be further treated and diluted, and the release will take decades to complete. Despite Tokyo's assurances that the discharge will not pose a threat to people or the environment, the decision has been criticized by the local fishing community, environmental groups, and Japan's neighbors. The damaged Fukushima plant will take at least decades to decommission, and a swath of land around the plant remains uninhabitable.
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[Message(role='you', content='{"command": {"name": "google", "args": {"query": "scientific studies on the potential environmental impact of treated nuclear wastewater in the pacific ocean"}}}', type='ai_response'), Message(role='your computer', content='Command google returned: ["https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC9659344/", "https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2666683921000183", "https://www.nationalgeographic.com/premium/article/fukushima-japan-nuclear-wastewater-pacific-ocean", "https://www.epa.gov/ocean-dumping/learn-about-ocean-dumping", "https://pubs.acs.org/doi/10.1021/es202816c", "https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35170214/", "https://19january2017snapshot.epa.gov/www3/region9/water/recycling/", "https://www.jhunewsletter.com/article/2021/04/fukushima-dumping-radioactive-wastewater-in-the-pacific-is-an-easy-but-wrong-solution"]', type='action_result')]
"""
